revisionDesc.change: updated TEI header to follow new encoding of respStmt within titlStmt; moved notes to external notes file and replaced with ptr encoding; removed empty opener elements
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Fixed reference to Duty as Jessie Louisa.
Made proofreading corrections, annotated Horace Greeley's Tribune, New York Times, Zachariah Chandler's impeachment speech, and "lame arm duty had the croup"
Replace straight quotes with smart quotes
corrected date in title, added call no., annotations

body.p:
here we are with another awfull awful snow storm it is awful in the extreme and jeff has just started for the perbasco Probasco region matt was going with him and going on to philadelpha Philadelphia to masons to stay till saturday Saturday but the storm was so very bad that jeffy thought she had better not go she had her hat and all on ready they were to go yesterday but it stormed so they put it off till to day and its worse yet matt wants to go very much i was willing she should go but i would have had a pretty hard time with dooing doing the work and davis to cook for with my lame arm duty had the croup last night not very bad but matty thought if she had it and she was gone i would be so frightened she concluded to take her and the storm so bad i thought it was endangering the childs life but they dident didn't go it was bad enoughf enough for Jeff) i dont don't think george can come up to day he came up yesterday in the cars it is very bad to get here after you get out of the cars its awful looking place any how i beleeve believe their there is dissatisfaction amongst the commisioners commissioners so many men to work
Jeff is pleased with his visit to washington he likes the Oconors very much says he spent a very agreable agreeable evening there we are very much pleased with mr Heydes present to you the scenery is beautiful Jeff told me how near you come to upset all the sympathy between you and your brother in law) you speak about sending the papers Walt but i think it would not be worth while once in a while i see the tribune i dont don't get very much time between georges coming up every day and the children up here nearly all the time but i like so to read the speakery in the house i read Chandlers Chandler's speech and i generally see the sunday paper davis takes the times every day but he is so queer about it leaves it over to the office Jeff says for to not ask him for it i got your letter walt yesterday with the 5 dollars i feel Walt sometimes as if you was too liberallliberal with me but its all i have except sometimes 15 or 20 cents and i pay the rent too one month Jeff only charged me 5 dollar matty says he has to pay just the same as they did before they took the long room Jeff is very kind to me i wonder sometimes he is for every little thing is told him even to burning a little wood when i ought to burn coal but i let every thing slide along but i think matty gets better) but we get along pretty well my arm is about the same no worse nor much better take all the comfort you can walt

postscript.p: the wind is this side of the house and its almost impossible to keep warm
